results.title: Dues and the union
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Morten Parker and David Bairstow
results.brief_description: The importance of the regular payment of union dues and how they keep a union going is told through the story of a young pipefitter. New to the trade and to his responsibilities as a union member, Frank Weston found there was much to learn about both. Fortunately for him, his boss on the job - a skilled tradesman and a founder of the union - had the patience to teach him. Through him Frank learns the significance of prompt dues payment and the services provided by them, and comes to enjoy the satisfaction of active and interested union membership.

results.title: Duel in the sun
results.creator_credit: David O Selznick Productions, David O. Selznick and King Vidor
results.brief_description: Scott Chavez, hung for the murder of his wife and her lover, sends his daughter to live with land baron Senator McCanles. The senator’s sons are immediately drawn to Pearl and fall under her spell. Brother is pitted against brother in this classic western filled with love, betrayal and murder. Starring Gregory Peck and Jennifer Jones as the ill-fated lovers and an admirable cast including Joseph Cotten, Lionel Barrymore, Herbert Marshall, Lillian Gish, Walter Huston and Charles Bickford.

results.title: Duel
results.creator_credit: Universal Pictures, George Eckstein and Steven Spielberg
results.brief_description: What begins as an ordinary business trip becomes a haunting life and death battle for Dennis Weaver in Steven Spielberg’s highly acclaimed first film. Initially Weaver refuses to believe he is being followed by a huge diesel truck, but soon the unbelievable horror of the situation sinks in. Based on a story by Richard Matheson who also wrote the screenplay.

results.title: Dudu and the line
results.creator_credit: Second Banana Films and Steve French
results.brief_description: Explores the magic and fun of animation through Dudu, an ordinary little chap who encounters an extraordinary line which obeys nothing but the animator’s imagination. Suitable for middle and upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Ducks, of course
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Peter Jones, John Howe and William H. Carrick
results.brief_description: That one duck is not necessarily the same as another is made clear in this film, which has as its objective the protection of the dwindling species. The star of the film is a hunter who is obviously light on duck lore but heavy on the trigger. By the time everything has been made clear, he (and the viewer) knows a good deal more about duck identification.

results.title: Duck soup
results.brief_description: The funniest Marx Brothers film is thankfully free of tacked-on studio romance, free of sentimentality and it is joyously anarchic. Groucho is head of the struggling country of Freedonia. Battling power-hungry courtiers and devious politicians, the four brothers have to defend their tiny country from the threat of war. “Duck Soup” includes some of the funniest dialogue and innovative visual comedy in the history of film including the classic “fake-mirror” scene, the lemonade-stand torture scene and the Civil War spoof. This film has inspired directors as diverse as Woody Allen and Stanley Kubrick. “Duck Soup” is hilarious, witty, and vulgar. War has never been so ridiculous, patriotism has never been so wondefully subverted.

results.title: Duck hunter's dilemma
results.creator_credit: University of Minnesota and Minnesota Museum of Natural History
results.brief_description: Shows the nature and extent of present waterfowl problems in America. Illustrates how game biologists are carrying out field experiments on bird habits and how the results and conclusions of this research are being put to practical use in the preservation and fostering of the waterfowl population.

results.title: Duck farming: an indonesian tradition
results.creator_credit: CSIRO, Nick Anderson and Peter Donaldson
results.brief_description: Duck farming has been an integral part of Indonesian society for centuries. A Research Institute in Java, set up by the Indonesian and Australian governments, aims to increase productivity by improved breeding and feeding techniques. The film explores the variety of techniques and traditions and, in the process, gives a unique perspective to the complexities of Indonesian society.
